value.name: Hillary Clinton falsely claims Capitol rioters 'killed a policeman'
value.description: Former Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton incorrectly claimed that the Capitol rioters “killed a police officer.”

value.name: Three Belleville police officers charged with assault related to man's arrest
value.description: Ontario's police watchdog says three officers from Belleville, Ont., have been charged with assault related to the arrest of a man a year and a half ago.

value.name: SIU charges three city officers
value.description: The director of Ontario’s Special Investigations Unit has charged three Belleville police officers with assault causing bodily harm in connection with a 2019 arrest at a city restaurant. The provincial unit,

value.name: 3 Belleville police officers charged with assault causing bodily harm by SIU
value.description: Ontario's Special Investigations Unit has charged three Belleville police officers for an arrest that led to serious injuries in November 2019.

video.name: Two Belleville police officers charged with assault causing bodily harm

value.name: Senate to hold key vote on Capitol riot commission
value.description: Senate Republicans are expected to block the House-passed Jan. 6 commission bill today as infrastructure negotiations continue in Congress. Follow here for the latest from Capitol Hill.

value.name: A Second Police Officer Who Responded to Capitol Riots Has Died by Suicide
value.description: Contee III revealed in his opening statement to a closed session of the House Appropriations Committee that one of his officers, Jeffrey Smith, died by suicide days after the riot. Smith ...

value.name: Mother of slain Capitol Police officer urges GOP senators to back Jan. 6 commission
value.description: The mother of a Capitol Police officer who died after engaging with the mob during the Jan. 6 insurrection pleaded with Republican senators on Thursday to vote for legislation that would establish a bipartisan commission to investigate the attack on the Capitol.

value.name: House Approves $1.9 Billion for Capitol Security
value.description: House lawmakers narrowly passed a massive emergency spending bill in response to the Jan. 6 attack at the U.S. Capitol by a violent mob, but its fate looks bleak in the Senate.

value.name: Man who shot woman in road rage confrontation says she threatened to stab him, but Spokane police don’t find knife
value.description: Richard Hough says he shot Erika Kienas because she threatened to stab him and he worried for himself and his family. Hough never saw a knife, and police did not find a knife on scene.

value.name: Jen Psaki claims 'a number of officers' died the day of the Capitol riot
value.description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki claimed Thursday there were “a number of officers” who died the day of the Capitol riot, despite a D.C. medical examiner's office determining that officer Brian Sicknick died the day after as a result of a stroke.

value.name: Drunk female police officer was arrested by colleague at force leaving do after she 'used the N-word, threatened her partner and hurled abuse at homeless man'
value.description: She was at a party for colleague PC Jeffrey Smith in the Brewery Quarter when he realised 'things were getting out of hand'. PC Smith said he remembered hearing Parr use the 'N-word' on the night.

value.name: Pelosi says Capitol Police to get Congressional Gold Medal for heroism during Jan. 6 riot
value.description: Pelosi said the attack on the Capitol highlighted the "extraordinary valor" of Capitol Police who "risked their lives," including Officers Howard Leibengood, Jeffrey Smith and Eugene Goodman.
